metadata.author: GitHub Copilot
metadata.description: Implement progress state validation with confirmation popups in Create Application modal

description: Add progress transition validation and confirmation popups to the Create Application modal form
rationale: Users should not be able to arbitrarily change progress without confirmation. When creating/editing applications, changing progress from 0â†’>0 should trigger 'Start' popup, >0â†’0 should trigger 'Reset' popup, and other transitions should be validated similar to the inline table editor.
impact: Create Application modal now enforces the same progress state machine as the inline table editor, ensuring consistent behavior and user confirmation for critical state changes.
changes: Added modalProgressState tracking variable initialized to { currentProgress: 0, previousStatus: 'TBS' } when modal opens
Added listener on appProgressInput.change() that validates transitions using detectProgressTransition()
When transition requires popup, calls showProgressPopup() with appropriate type (START/RESET/REOPEN/COMPLETION/UPDATE)
On confirmation, updates appStatusInput based on transition type
On cancellation, reverts the progress value to previous state

validation.beforeExecute: Modal allows setting progress without validation or status updates
validation.afterExecute: Modal validates progress changes and shows popups when needed, updates status automatically

manual: Verify Progress reverts to 0 and Status reverts to 'TBS'
Verify app is created with Progress=50 and Status=WIP
